text:
The formatOutput(String type, String output) method of the class 
XMLJUnitResultFormatter embeds the output string in a CDATA section.  If the 
output string itself has a CDATA section, an invalid XML file is produced. 

One way to solve this is to remove all CDATA section end delimiters from the 
output string prior to writing.
creator: goetze@dovetail.com
bodewig@apache.org
text:
Are you sure you are using 1.5.3?  DOMElementWriter which produces the output file
is supposed to take care of this - and in fact does AFAICS - since January.

So this bug is supposed to be fixed with 1.5.2+.

creator: goetze@dovetail.com
text:
I *was* using a downlevel version of Ant (1.5.1).  I have retested under 1.5.3 
and confirm that the Formatter correctly handles embedded CDATA sections.

Sorry for the confusion.
